prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
A man is being questioned by authorities following a young child's cardiac arrest at a local amusement park.

The one-year-old girl remains in critical condition at the hospital after the incident at FunWorld on Friday afternoon, according to police.

A 34-year-old man from London was taken into custody on suspicion of child neglect and endangerment. He is currently being held for questioning.

Detective Inspector Sarah Clark of the Child Protection Unit stated, "Our thoughts are with the family of the young girl who is in a critical condition in the hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest. We are working closely with the staff at FunWorld, but we would like to speak to anyone who has information about this incident, specifically anyone who was in the vicinity of the carousel between 1:00 pm and 2:30 pm."

She further added, "We urge the public to avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the family's privacy during this difficult time."

The amusement park released a statement saying, "On Friday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to support the police with their ongoing investigation."

The police have stated that they are not seeking any further suspects in relation to the incident.

A woman is being questioned by the authorities following a toddler's sudden collapse at a popular children's museum.

The three-year-old boy is in critical condition at the hospital after the incident at ImagineWorld on a sunny Saturday afternoon, according to the authorities.

A 38-year-old woman from the city was taken into custody on suspicion of child neglect and endangerment. She is currently being held for questioning.

Detective Sergeant John Moore of the Child Protection Unit stated, "Our thoughts are with the family of the young boy who is in a critical condition in the hospital after collapsing suddenly. We are working closely with the staff at ImagineWorld, but we would like to speak to anyone who has information about this incident, specifically anyone who was in the vicinity of the interactive exhibit between 12:00 pm and 1:30 pm."

He further added, "We urge the public to avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the family's privacy during this difficult time."

The children's museum released a statement saying, "On Saturday, a young guest took unwell... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to support the police with their ongoing investigation."

The authorities have stated that they are not seeking any further suspects in relation to the incident.

The five-year-old girl is in critical condition at the hospital following the incident at ExploreZone on a busy Sunday afternoon, according to the authorities.

A 45-year-old man from the town was taken into custody on suspicion of child neglect and endangerment. He is currently being held for questioning.

The 7-year-old boy is now in stable condition at the hospital, after the incident at the Interactive Robotics Exhibit on a bustling Sunday afternoon, as confirmed by officials.

A 45-year-old woman from the city was detained on suspicion of negligence and endangerment. She is being held for further questioning.

Detective John Smith of the Juvenile Crimes Unit shared, "Our thoughts and prayers are with the young boy who is in the hospital after suddenly falling ill. We are closely working with the science center staff, and we are eager to talk to anyone who has information about this incident, specifically anyone who was near the popular exhibit between 1:00 pm and 3:30 pm."

He added, "We ask the public to refrain from spreading false information about the incident and to respect the boy's privacy during this difficult time."

The science center released a statement saying, "On Sunday, a young guest became unwell... and our fully trained First Aid team provided immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We will continue to assist the police with their ongoing investigation."

The authorities have stated that they are not searching for any additional suspects in relation to the incident.
